subSections.title: Chinese
subSections.text: {{zh-forms|s=爱|alt=㤅,𢙴,𢛭,𢜤,𤔠,𤔤,𢟪,𢖻}}

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}

Originally {{zh-l|*㤅}}, a {{Han compound|旡|心|ls=psc|c1=p|c2=s|t2=heart|nocap=1}}.

As early as the Qin dynasty, a meaningless component {{zh-l|*夊|foot}} was added to the bottom of the character, as with some other characters depicting people. Compare {{zh-l|*憂}} (from {{zh-l|*㥑}}).

Further corruption turned the original phonetic {{zh-l|*旡}} into {{lang|zh|⿱爫冖}}.

subSections.title: Definitions
Synonyms
subSections.text: {{zh-dial|喜歡}}

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: * When used for people, {{lang|zh|愛}}／{{lang|zh|爱}} usually refers to romantic love. When used like this, older Mandarin speakers often describe the use of this term as overly {{zh-l|肉麻|cheesy}}. For this reason, the word {{zh-l|喜歡|to like}} might be used instead. Using the word {{zh-l|喜歡}} literally means ''like'', but when used in a romantic context (especially boyfriend/girlfriend), it actually means love. However, younger Mandarin speakers seem to have been influenced somewhat by Western culture, and are now using the verb {{lang|zh|愛}}／{{lang|zh|爱}} much more often than was socially acceptable in the past.

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|あい|yomi=o}}
From {{bor|ja|ltc|-|sort=あい}} {{m|ltc|愛|tr=ʔoj<sup>H</sup>|t=to love}}). Compare modern {{cog|cmn|-}} {{zh-l|愛|ài}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=o|あい|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

subSections.title: Noun
Synonyms
Derived terms
subSections.text:
* {{ja-r|愛する|あいする}}: to love
* {{ja-r|愛らしい|あいらし.い}}: lovely
* {{ja-r|愛してる|あいしてる}}: I love you

subSections.title: Idioms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|愛して 見れば 鼻%欠け も 靨|あいして みれば はな%かけ も えくぼ}}: “if you love someone, even a missing nose is only a dimple” ⇒ when you love someone, you minimize their flaws

subSections.title: Proper noun
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|めで|yomi=k}}
The {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of {{inh|ja|ojp|-|sort=めで}} verb {{m|ja|愛づ|tr=medzu||to love; to appreciate or admire}}, modern form {{m|ja|愛でる|tr=mederu}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR"/>

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|めで|acc=2}}

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|愛で}}, {{ja-l|目出}}

subSections.title: Noun
Idioms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|愛の盛り|めで の さかり}}: the [[height]] of [[love]], the [[utmost]] love

subSections.title: Related terms
subSections.text:
* {{ja-r|愛でる|めでる}}: to love; to admire or appreciate
* {{ja-r|愛でたい|めでたい}}: favorable

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|まな|yomi=k}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=まな|真|tr1=ma|t1=true, genuine|な|tr2=na}}, an {{inh|ja|ojp|-|sort=まな}} version of modern {{cog|ja|の|tr=no|pos=possessive particle}}.<ref name="KDJ"/> The use of {{lang|ja|愛}} here is an example of [[ateji]].

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|まな|acc=0}}

subSections.title: Etymology 4
subSections.text: Used as [[ateji]] in various names. {{lang|ja|愛}} is a very common element in many, many names.
